metadata.title: CVE-2016-9118 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap Buffer Overflow (WRITE of size 4) in function pnmtoimage ofconvert.c:1719 in OpenJPEG 2.1.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.2
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.2').
